ComicInfo.Title: Brush Strokes; Second Chance; The Hanging Thread; The Fly in the Ointment; Introducing the Weaver
ComicInfo.Summary:
Brush Strokes: Fate helps Paul Prenz finally paint a real piece of art, but he is unable to repeat the feat and must return to commercial work.
Second Chance: Humans and immortals debate what is stronger: fate or love.
The Hanging Thread: Fate tells how a common fly (helped by Fate, of course) once thwarted a king and his torturer in their pursuit of a beautiful woman.
The Fly in the Ointment: The wife of gladiator Gracchus urges him to rebel against Crassius and his outright thievery of the people's money. Gracchus kills Crassius, then flees with Ledra to her uncle's town where they will be safe. Unknown to anyone, on August 24, 79 A.D., that town, Pompeii, was to be destroyed by an eruption of a volcano.
Introducing the Weaver: Fate helps an old man split a diamond perfectly.
